intro: Escobaria zilziana subsp. fricii, commonly known as the Frici's liveforever, is a succulent plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features pale green, fleshy stems and produces yellow flowers during the spring. It is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. Its botanical structure reflects its ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
